ratings.comment: Gwyn is a great econ professor. She teaches the lecture clearly and she answers questions very patiently. She is very nice to students. And this course is easy. Just follow up during the lectures and finish some practice problems. There are no hard and frustrated questions during exam or problem sets.
Very good professor, she was enthusiastic and tried her best to make online courses interesting, and she helped a lot in the homework. finally got 100.1/100

Gwyn is really a nice person and a brilliant professor. She makes the lectures very well organized. Everything are super clear. Do the ps and practice problems, and you will be fine with the exams. There is a final capstone project, which makes you utilize class materials into a real consulting case. Would recommend this course!

Great Professor. Can tell she has a strong grip on the content and cares about conveying the information to students. Sometimes lectures can drag on when she goes over studies but they're worth understanding for the class as a whole. Handled going online very well so you can tell she cares for her students and how much they learn.
Pauley was super nice, however the exams were really hard.

Professor Pauley is very encouraging and she helped me gain more confidence in the material. The class is moderately difficult, but the tests are fairly straightforward, and as long as you do the homework and keep doing practice problems you should do fine.

Professor Pauley really cares about how well her students do in her class. Although the class is difficult, her exams are straightforward and much like the homework. Would recommend over any other Econ 101 professor.

Pop-Quizes on the readings. Usually pretty easy just make sure you skim the abstracts and methods etc. before you go. Also, by reading the title of the paper you can usually BS your way through it. Lowest is dropped. Exams are very similar to problem sets. Pauley is kinda boring but nice and the class is a breeze. Just practice the PS before tests

Gwyn's lectures were interesting and the tests were straightforward (she also gives practice exams that are really similar in style to the actual exams). However, what really impressed me was that she is the ONLY professor I have ever had that takes the time to go through entire problem sets with students during office hours, which was so helpful.

Gwyn is not one of my top professors at UW. Her class is sometimes painful because she does not put much enthusiasm in her teaching. She is a good person and much of the time is available outside for any more doubts. Her text was easy but would not take another course with her because of her teaching style.

Honestly, this class was challenging for me BUT Gwyn was IMO the best prof to have for this course! She's very accessible outside of class and in office hours, she helps a TON. I also think she is one of the most genuine people, basically she made me feel like I could pass the course and was very encouraging when she could see I was nervous.

Do not buy a paper copy of the textbook! Only need the online version and you'll save a lot of money. She's nice out of class if you go to office hours but I found the lectures very dry and hard to sit through. Homework is online and it's very easy to get points off for tiny mistakes. Overall, this class is hard and boring but not impossible.
Gwyn is awesome! She's really nice and very clear in her lectures. If you need any help she is available. Behavioral Economics is an interesting course subject as well.

Made herself available with extra office hours before exams. She sometimes drew the wrong graph but always corrected herself. Every lecture began with a review of the content taught in the last lecture. Any bad review is likely because of the grade the person received in the class. Go to class, do the homework, and you will get a good grade.
Content is clearly communicated. Tests are straightforward and based off homework and discussion problems.

Professor Pauley was unclear about grading all semester. The grade in the grade book was completely wrong because nothing was weighted until the end, which is super unhelpful going into exams. She also has no personality and would teach misleading concepts because she forgot the correct graph.
One of the best professors on campus. Go to her office hours because she will help you a lot with the homework. Exams were very straight forward.

I really can't understand the one negative review here (or more if they come up). Gwyn is one of the most caring human beings on the planet. She literally walked through homework questions, making sure every student understood them. I didn't find the material interesting (A LOT of readings) but in terms of a good persons, Gwyn rates at the top

Material for this class is challenging. However, Pauley's tests are straightforward in that they are exactly based off the material taught in lecture, on the homeworks, and on worksheets. The TAs can be bad, and she doesn't do many numerical examples in lecture, but as long as you study and do the homeworks you'll be fine. There are huge curves
Great professor!
